intro: Scleria multispiculata, commonly known as the spiked bulrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, cylindrical inflorescence composed of numerous spikelets, each bearing small, three-lobed flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, typically growing in dense clusters at the base of the plant. Scleria multispiculata thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies.
